g.text: in reductive atmosphere is relatively dangerous and
leads to a higher cost of phosphors. In addition, the
environmental pollution will be produced if the reac-
tion is proceeded under CO-reducing conditions.
Therefore, a green, eco-friendly, and lower cost prep-
aration method has attracted more attention.

these compounds contain rigid tetrahedral BO
surrounding and insulating the produced Eu
]. Zeolites, as one kind of alu-
minosilicate, not only are natural minerals, but also
can be synthesized in industry at a lower cost [

widely used as excellent host materials for lumines-
cent material applications because of the high
1) has been used as host material
for down-conversion phosphor. Herein, we achieve
thermal treatment method without any reducing at-
phosphor has a quantum yield of about 36.6%. This
preparation method is safe, green, and environmen-
tally friendly. The broad excitation band of the sam-
ple we obtained is in the range of 310
the peak of emission band is located at 523 nm.
And the samples are stable and easily re-prepared.
Eu phosphor on a UV-emitting chip, we acquire a
good green LED with the Commission Internation-
age. These results not only show a simple and eco-
friendly preparing approach but provide an excellent
green emission phosphor with promising applica-
tions in the fields of lighting and display.
green emission through safe, green, and environmentally
friendly synthesis method, without any reducing
1) purchased from Shanghai Tongxing Molecular Sieve
Sinopharm Co., Ltd, were used without any further puri-
fication. Silicone resin and InGaN blue chip (5 mm× 5
= 375 nm) were received from Shenzhen Looking
-actived zeolite-3A samples were prepared by using
a typical high-temperature solid-state reaction method.
Firstly, different stoichiometric amounts of zeolite-3A
were mixed well and thoroughly ground in
an agate mortar for 40 min. And then, they were sintered
at different temperature without reducing atmosphere.
Finally, the target samples were gained after cooling.
-actived zeolite-3A powder and silicone resin were
blended according to 1:5 of mass ratio, then stirring homo-
geneously. The composition was coated on an InGaN chip
and cured under 60 °C for about 2 h. Finally, the thickness
of the composite was measured to be about 1 mm.
The morphology and structure of the resulting products
were characterized through field emission scanning elec-
tron microscope (FESEM, FEI Sirion-200) and X-ray dif-
curves were measured by SDT Q600 V20.9 Build 20,
which were obtained from room temperature to 800 °C
with a heating rate of 10 °C/min in a nitrogen atmos-
phere (flow rate 10 ml/min). The photoluminescence ex-
obtained at room temperature using Edinburgh Instru-
ments FLS920 Time Resolved and Steady State Fluores-
cence Spectrometers equipped with a 450-W Xe lamp.
The oxidation state of europium element was investi-
gated by X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS, ESCA-
investigated by Ocean Optics FLAME-S-VIS-NIR spec-
trometer with a fiber integrating sphere (FOIS-1) and a

3A. It can be observed that the morphology of the
pristine zeolite-3A is irregular cubic structure with
